Alex and Isabel had decided, or rather Alex had had enough of Miami and wanted to move on, so now he had contacted maria told her they were going to Max and Liz's and he wanted her there too. Whether she'd show was a different story if not he'd pop in on her soon. He waited for Isabel and smiled, it felt nice to have her back again. It felt nice to be breathing again.
http://fromthebeyond.livejournal.com/5362.html

I remember when I first saw Isabel, we weren't in High School yet. We were in the sixth grade and that's when I noticed her. She was beautiful even then. People talked about her, okay guys talked about her. People wanting to just sleep with her, just to use her or win a bet. Talked about various body parts. For me though it was always two things of hers that got my attention. Her eyes. They always showed so much more then the outside showed. So much wisdom were mirrored in her eyes, and I could see it. Most thought she was an airhead, but i knew the truth. I could tell she had an old soul as it were. I always knew there was more to Isabel then she let others see. That she closed herself off. The other thing? Her smile. It lit up the room whether she knows it or not, it did and still does. What makes it better? She always had a smile on her face, though at times I could tell that it was plastered there and was fake. A real smile would reach her eyes, and light them up. The corners of her lips would be upturned. A fake smile her eyes were dull and lifeless, the corners were either straight or if really bad down turned. I like her real genuine smiles the best. She looks good happy. Of course when you are the geek looking at checking out the pretty girl, the jocks that want a piece of her turn into animals. They will also throw you head first into a trash can and warn you to never look at their girl again, even if she wasn't theirs. Never stopped me. I remember though that was the day I fell for Isabel, just got stronger over the years. Now that I have her back, I don't want to lose her again. I'm thinking marriage here. Alex Whitman Roswell 318 Words
http://fromthebeyond.livejournal.com/4900.html
Miami is done. Where should we go next? Any ideas?
http://fromthebeyond.livejournal.com/4721.html

01) My best friends are Liz Parker and Maria de Luca. I have other friends, but those two have been my best friends since I was a kid. 02) I don't trust people easily. I never really have. It's not because I think people are bad it's just the way I grew up. I was always the geeky kid people picked on. The one they were friendly to when they needed something. 03) I love playing music. It let's me unwind and relax. I used to tease the women dug musicians, but it was just something I was good at. Good at that wasn't academic. 04) I used to think the people of Roswell were all nuts because of their alien infatuation. Then again some of them are nuts. 05) I used to think that Liz and Maria were all the people I needed. Then I met Max, Michael, and Isabel and realized there was room for more people in my life. 06) I'd die to save my friends. The way I see it they have these greater things to accomplish then I do. So I wouldn't hesitate to lay my life down for theirs. 07) I stripped once. Enough said. 08) I've been in jail. I didn't do anything but was being held to try and get me to turn in my friend Liz persay. For the record, I didn't. Instead I told Sheriff Valenti that we were being held under false circumstances and that if the sheriff didn't release us immediately, I was going to find a lawyer and sue for abusive treatment to a minor. Yes I'm a pretty smart guy. Goes with the geek status. 09) I'm a romantic. I like to do the whole dinner and dancing thing. Candlelit dinner and some nice music to dance to. I'm the kind of guy that will send flowers just because I want to see the person smile. 10) I'm in love with a beautiful woman named Isabel Evans that I want to marry someday. Muse: Alex Whitman Fandom: Roswell
http://fromthebeyond.livejournal.com/4421.html

Name's Alex Whitman. I'm originally from Roswell, New Mexico. Not a place i can really go back to. It's a small town and they might end up noticing the dead geek walking around town. Yes I died, I won't get into how I died. I don't know how I am even here. I'm not complaining though I'm getting a second chance at a few things.


Right now I'm in Miami. Sun. Fun. Beautiful women. And the geek. See something that doesn't fit? Things are looking up though. 


<small>Alex is from Roswell, he's AU obviously. He's open for rp and fun. He doesn't bite.</small>

http://fromthebeyond.livejournal.com/3444.html

<i>I have to believe in second chances because I am a walking example. I know I shouldn't be here, I'm reminded in my friends eyes when they see me. They mean nothing by it I know but it freaks them out a bit that I'm not dead. I can't say that I blame them either because I even freak myself out sometimes.


I do know one thing, I don't plan to waste my second chance at life. I plan to make the most of it. I want to be there for Maria and Liz. For Michael. I really want to be there for Isabel. I fully intend on making sure she knows just how much I love her, even if she doesn't feel the same any longer. She deserves to know that to at least me, she's the most incredible woman I have ever met. She's more human then a lot of humans with her caring spirit. My second chance at life I want to make count, make it worth something.

Second chances? Yes I believe in them, and I don't think a single moment should be wasted if you are given one. Make it count. Don't waste it. Don't throw it away. If you get a second chance, live it and use it to it's fullest, because if given one you are the luckiest person in the world.


Alex Whitman
Roswell
242
http://fromthebeyond.livejournal.com/3236.html

Not really I mean I'm usually 'that geeky kid' or 'the nerd' so friends are hard to come by. I did have some friends and they were the best ones you could ever hope for. They didn't care how I looked, or how I dressed. They liked the fact my IQ was bigger then my shoe size. Liz Parker and Maria DeLuca. Yes I had girlfriends err well friends who are girls, only had one girlfriend but yeah later. Those two were or are my best friends, always there when I needed them. We could talk about anything from foods, movies, to science and philosophy. They were like my sisters though people always asked me why I didn't try anything. I mean come on I say they are like my sisters and ask that, it'd be like incest. Of course through those two I made other friends, Max Evans, Isabel Evans, Michael Guerin, and Kyle Valenti. Even more friends who were there but then our group were more like a family. We all looked out for each other, watching the backs of everyone else while they had yours. That's what it was all about, what true friendship is. [locked to above mentioned people] Though what we had to go through in watching each others backs was a lot different then what normal people go through. Though I think in the end that made us the more stronger. We knew the risks of losing one another and we did everything we could to keep everyone safe. I also want you all to know I have no ill feelings about my death. If any of you are feeling some iota of guilt over it, there is no need. None of it was your fault and you should rest assured that I still respect and love each of you the same as I always have. There was nothing you could have done to stop it. [unlocked] I suppose in some ways I could say yes and no on whether I make friends easily. I have the ability to do so if you can see past the stereotypes of society, but it is also because of aforementioned stereotypes that it's hard for me to make friends. Alex Whitman Roswell 380 words
http://fromthebeyond.livejournal.com/2934.html

<i>Describe a dream you had as a child that has stayed with you.

<small>I dreamed of becoming a doctor when I was a little boy and of winning the Nobel Peace prize. I would go to sleep at night and it would all play out in my head, I had even written a practice speech for it because my dream seemed so real. Though my dreams tend to do that though the dream that stays with me the most was one I didn't have as a child but as a teenager. The most vivid dream I have ever had or series of dreams. They always involved me and Isabel Evans, one of the most beautiful girls in the school but it was so much more then that with her. She was funny and she was intelligent, a rare flower amongst weeds as some would say or a diamond in the rough as yet even others would say.

It was a nice fancy dinner this one dream was, I was dressed in a nice black tuxedo, then Isabel came into the dream. My dream self couldn't speak for a moment she was so beautiful, her hair all set up in curls. Those waves of spun golden framing her face perfectly, and the dress she wore, stunning red just made her look perfect. We danced and I held her in my arms telling her how beautiful she was, in my dreams those were our moments. Ones I never thought could be had in the real world so I settled for my dreams.</small>

Alex Whitman
Roswell
250 Words



If you could change one thing in history, what would it be and why?

<small>I'd go back and maybe change it so I didn't have to die and leave those I cared about behind. Those who let me in and felt more like a family to me then my own true family. Always there for each other to back the other up. Liz and Maria they were like my sisters, I had known them for so long and I'd do anything to protect them. Kyle, Max and Michael were my brothers, Max the compassionate caring one, and Michael the brash enforcer that would protect his own no matter what. He didn't need to show emotion for you to know he was there for you. Kyle the one that could always make me smile no matter how stressed things could be he was always trying to keep spirits up some.

Then there was Isabel who was so much more to me then I had ever thought possible, she was the woman I loved more then anything. The woman I would have given my life to protect on a deeper level then those of my friends. I know everyone understood and knew, that in the end if two were in trouble and I could only save one some ounce of chivalry would have me rushing to say my lady fair.

We even had our father, Sheriff Valenti who risked so much, gave up so much to keep us safe. To protect us all as best as he could with no concern to himself. He was selfless and cared unconditionally like a father should.

I watched over them all, but now I am here once more unsure whether best to approach or not.</small>


Alex Whitman
Roswell
280 words
http://fromthebeyond.livejournal.com/2326.html

'What doesn't kill us makes us stronger.' Do you agree or disagree? Why? The pain you can feel at the loss of another can eat you up inside, I've seen this happen in the case of my death. I watched how everyone felt as if part of them was ripped away. Though the hardest to watch was Isabel, that hurt me on so many levels. I had loved her, still love her, to see her feel so broken because of me in the small way it was. Made me ache inside and I prayed for them to all be able to get through it. Then I watched them get through the pain, overcome the pieces within they had thought dead. I watched them go on with their lives, picking up the pieces. I wished I could be part of their lives again, to laugh with them. To be able to protect them, and to be part of something once more. I could only watch, then when Isabel met Jesse, I saw she could be happy with someone again. I also saw her hesitation and her memories of what we had. I did the most painful thing I had to do, I helped convince her to move on. To be happy with Jesse, marry him then maybe she could have the life I had dreamed of giving her. Then I was there watching the day she married him, I saw the smile on her face and it gave me a strength to know that maybe, just maybe she'd be alright. Then I watched as she left him behind, as their world crumbled and I couldn't do anything to help them. I watched them die inside with my death, then I saw them all take that pain and turn it into strength and conviction to go on. So I can agree with the saying 'that which does not kill us, makes us stronger' because Max, Liz, Maria, Michael, and Isabel showed me the truth in those words. Now I am here, the how and why I've stopped asking. Maybe it's my second chance to feel I belong somewhere. Alex Whitman Roswell 348 Words
http://fromthebeyond.livejournal.com/2267.html

<i>If Tess hadn't killed me what would life be like for me now? Would me and Isabel still be together? Would she had married me instead of Jesse if I were here? Would we have been able to find a place to settle down and try to live a normal life. Would we of had children? How many? Would we of been happy? So many questions set off by such a simple word.


If...


If the world had been a different place, and accepting of who Max, Isabel, Michael, and even Tess were. Would I of ever even stood a chance of getting close to Isabel? Would she have ever noticed me? Or would we have continued to pass each other in the halls, her oblivious to my existence and me admiring her from afar? 


These are questions I'll never get to know the answers to. I was robbed of some of what could have been a happy future with someone I loved. Now I've returned and I'll still never know. I don't even know if Isabel knows I'm back, or if she even cares or wants to know. I wish I could find the answers so I can get over the haunting of a single word. A word that sets my mind swirling.


If...




Alex Whitman
Roswell
221 words
http://fromthebeyond.livejournal.com/1991.html

<i>Anyone that knows me would think my books would be my retreat, my love of learning new things. To broadening my horizons and furthering my knowledge. That is all fun and all but my retreat is something I find so much better.

My dreams.

The one place I can be anyone, be anything. Where I can be popular, or even date one of the most popular girls at school. I can be charming and sweet, to sweep someone off their feet. Romantic. Where people like me and want to know me and I'm not just some geek. Though most of my dreams soon came to center around one person, Isabel Evans.

I had such a big crush on her and at the time there was no way I'd just walk up to her and tell her that. I mean she's just beautiful, smart, funny, and look at me. I was realistic, but in my dreams where anything was possible. Isabel was mine, we laughed, we danced we spent time together. It was just me and her and I hated waking from those dreams. Those dreams I wished I could stay in because when I woke up I was just Alex again. Though as things went, me and Isabel did get to be together, then just like my dreams it ended. Only this time instead of it ending with my eyes opening, it ended with them closing. Now for some reason I am back, and I don't know what will happen or even why I am here. All I know is it's good to see my friends again.



Alex Whitman
Roswell
272 words
http://fromthebeyond.livejournal.com/1431.html

<i>Tourists. That's my biggest pet peeve. Don't get me wrong tourism does help the economy of a town, but in Roswell, New Mexico. We get the weird and sometimes insane tourists. They are either geeks dressed up as Spock sometimes, or the insane who want to come and hitch a ride on a spaceship. They want to be abducted by aliens and experimented on. That drives me crazy, walking down the street minding my own business and i get stopped and asked if I've lived here all my life. Yes I have. Then the question I know always comes next, have you ever met any aliens? What? No! I mean come on now get with reality people.


[locked to those who know of Aliens, Michael, Isabel, Max, and Tess]


See what people don't get is they watch way too many movies. I'm sure some do kidnap humans but they'd have a reason to do something like that. But not all aliens are like that. I know because that just wasn't Max, or Michael, or Isabel. Tess was a bit off but in the end even I couldn't blame her. Sometimes it's not the person or in this case alien hybrid, but it's how you were raised. Liz, Maria, and I we've been close to them and I can honestly say stereotypes suck. If these people only knew, we could see Hollywood losing a lot of money on this. Because the general public just gets that view of it. The evil invaders of Earth here to take over the world. That's just a big pet peeve, never liked alien movies before but after knowing the aliens I know. I feel sorry for them they have to deal with that, no wonder they so freaked out about people finding out. I would be too.


[unlocked]


I get asked all kinds of questions, like have I ever been probed by an alien, has an alien ever tried killing me, or the weirdest question I get. Ever had sex with an alien? Insanity I tell you.



Alex Whitman
Roswell
355 words
http://fromthebeyond.livejournal.com/1067.html

Describe a dream that you've had. How did the dream make you feel? Dreams can haunt, dreams can tease, can give you hope. I used to have these dreams of me and Isabel, where she wanted to be with me. We'd be having dinner and I was dressed up in a tux and Isabel, she just looked amazing. So breath taking, beautiful, intoxicating in an incredible looking red satin dress. She looked like a goddess, with her hair all down and hanging over her shoulders. We'd dance, my arm around her waist holding her close against me as we moved with the music. So close to me I could smell her perfume, she was so enchanting. It all felt so real like maybe I stood a chance beyond the dream world. I always hated waking up, having the dream end. Because when I was awake I knew it wasn't possible. That Isabel Evans deserved someone better then me. She was meant for greater. She was such an amazing person and I know to her I had to have been invisible. Though the dreams still made me smile because there, she was mine. Alex Whitman Roswell 182 Words
http://fromthebeyond.livejournal.com/936.html

What is one thing you have learned from your past? Alex Whitman learned to not be so close minded. To be open to the possibility of anything and everything. He used to think if it couldn't be proved with the wonders of science, it just didn't exist. That is until he met Max, Michael, Isabel, and Tess. Alex would have laughed at anyone that had said that aliens existed, but those four proved him wrong. They showed Alex a faith in science could be faulty, and that anything was possible. They opened Alex's eyes to a whole new world where truly anything could be real. Though there was one thing that totally through him off about that whole thing. Alex had the biggest crush on Isabel, finding out the girl you liked was from another planet well its a bit surreal. At first hethought it'd change how he felt, but it didn't. In that he learned something else, that no matter what you learn about someone, they are still the same person you know. Alex is grateful to those four, and to Maria and Liz, for letting him in. For showing him that anything and everything was possible. For teaching him to view the world with eyes wide open along with his mind open and ready for the possibility of so much more being out there. Alex Whitman Roswell 221 words
http://fromthebeyond.livejournal.com/755.html

Comfort can mean many things in the end, but there have been a few things that comfort me even now that I am dead.


I found comfort in knowing my friends Liz and Maria are safe though their lives have taken strange turns over the years. The others, I wish I knew if i could find them and know for sure I know I'd feel alot better.


The biggest comfort oddly enough was that Isobel was able to move on. That she found love again with jesse as much as it hurt me but I knew I couldn't be with her. Not anymore and she deserved to have someone that loved her that could hold her close at night. That could whisper they loved her in her ear. Itry sometimes to reach her through her dreams but I can never get in. I want her to know I'm alright where I am, and that even after all this time I still feel the same way about her. I don't know where her life has taken her, or if she's still with Jesse. But I'd like her to know, no matter what she is loved.


Alex Whitman
Roswell
